info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN WARREN, NORTHWESTERN CLINTON, SOUTHERN GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Waynesville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Beavercreek, Xenia, Springboro, Bellbrook, Oakwood, Wright-Patterson Afb, Waynesville, Jamestown, Wilberforce, Riverside, New Jasper, Harveysburg, Spring Valley, Corwin, Centerville, Paintersville, Lytle and Lumberton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
